1.text: Surely there is a mine for silver, And a place for gold which they refine.

2.text: Iron is taken out of the earth, And copper is molten out of the stone.

3.text: Man setteth an end to darkness, And searcheth out, to the furthest bound, The stones of obscurity and of thick darkness.

4.text: He breaketh open a shaft away from where men sojourn; They are forgotten of the foot; They hang afar from men, they swing to and fro.

5.text: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread; And underneath it is turned up as it were by fire.

6.text: The stones thereof are the place of sapphires, And it hath dust of gold.

7.text: That path no bird of prey knoweth, Neither hath the falconâ€™s eye seen it:

8.text: The proud beasts have not trodden it, Nor hath the fierce lion passed thereby.

9.text: He putteth forth his hand upon the flinty rock; He overturneth the mountains by the roots.

10.text: He cutteth out channels among the rocks; And his eye seeth every precious thing.

11.text: He bindeth the streams that they trickle not; And the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.

12.text: But where shall wisdom be found? And where is the place of understanding?

13.text: Man knoweth not the price thereof; Neither is it found in the land of the living.

14.text: The deep saith, It is not in me; And the sea saith, It is not with me.

15.text: It cannot be gotten for gold, Neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.

16.text: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, With the precious onyx, or the sapphire.

17.text: Gold and glass cannot equal it, Neither shall it be exchanged for jewels of fine gold.

18.text: No mention shall be made of coral or of crystal: Yea, the price of wisdom is above rubies.

19.text: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, Neither shall it be valued with pure gold.

20.text: Whence then cometh wisdom? And where is the place of understanding?

21.text: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, And kept close from the birds of the heavens.

22.text: Destruction and Death say, We have heard a rumor thereof with our ears.

23.text: God understandeth the way thereof, And he knoweth the place thereof.

24.text: For he looketh to the ends of the earth, And seeth under the whole heaven;

25.text: To make a weight for the wind: Yea, he meteth out the waters by measure.

26.text: When he made a decree for the rain, And a way for the lightning of the thunder;

27.text: Then did he see it, and declare it; He established it, yea, and searched it out.

28.text: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; And to depart from evil is understanding.
